summary: Rock and roll is a popular music genre that started in the United States in the late 1940s and early 1950s. It came from a mix of African American music styles like jazz, blues, and country music. The genre got its name in 1954. Early rock and roll used piano or saxophone as lead instruments, but later, the electric guitar became more popular. It has a strong, danceable beat. Rock and roll influenced American culture, fashion, and even the civil rights movement by bringing Black and White teenagers together.
title: Rock and roll
